item.title: Chapter 1
item.description:
Introduction#

  • CocaCola’s carbonated beverage market has steadily declined recently
    • James Quincy took the reins as CEO of Coca Cola in 2017
    • Soda sales account for 70% of total sales revenue
    • Wants to structure the organization for faster growth and to ensure they can respond to consumers needs
      • Restructured the corporate structure
      • Has sold off many bottling operations
    • Has branched out into many other areas inside bottling
      • Bottled water
      • Flavored water
      • Plant based beverages
      • Customers want healthier options
  • Create new streams of revenue while significantly cutting costs
    • Reducing staff
    • Deliberate management initiatives in order to sustain strong market position
      • The company has outgrown solely the Coca-Cola brand

A Manager’s Task#

  • Plant managers run manufacturing operation that produce the clothes that we wear
    • Sales managers maintain a sales force that markets goods
    • Provide organization for workforce
  • Also important because they serve a purpose in our lives
    • Catalyst for new and exciting products
      • Economy and standard of living
  • Our society would not exist without managers guidance
    • Jobs in management positions have increased from 10 to 18 percent since 1950
    • Managerial positions typically have higher salaries
